answers.answer: Hi,You seem to be suffering from sciatica. This condition arises due to some compression of sciatic nerve at any point along the entire length.To have a working diagnosis, it requires complete examination.Hence do seek your physician's opinion.Good luck

Hi.Tingling sensations could be caused by many conditions including diabetes, thyroid disorders, or vitamin and mineral deficiencies. However, the fact that it is worse when sitting might point to a nerve impingement/compression as a likely cause of the symptoms.You should have your symptoms evaluated by a physician.Hope this helps.

question: i am 41 years old very active 6 ' 4" 230lb male i workout about 5 days a week,,in the last 3 weeks i have had some tingling in my feet mostly in my left,,, i may have hurt my back doing yoga but i have no pain ,,the only back problem i have is about once about every six months i will get a catch in my back that will hurt down my left leg,, my low back seems kinda stiff and achy but i have no other problems,,also while standing i have little or no problems,,,i work about 50 hours a week in a chair at my job,,when i sit in my chair is when the tingling is the worst,,,any advice????
title: legs
